result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terri L. Turney

defendant.name: Turney, Terri L.
defendant.address: 205 Industrial Park Ln PO Box 4, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.

1:13 PM Defendant Terri L. Turney appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint. Court speaks to public defender seeking counsel report. State has no objection to amending bond. Court amends bond to $500.00 signature bond with conditions: Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises. Bond continued as amended.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report - 159 contacts

1:36 PM Defendant Terri L. Turney appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant on obtaining counsel. She is eligible. Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Not to possess, use, or ingest illegal drugs Maintain absolute sobriety, Not to possess or consume intoxicants, No taverns or to be in the tavern portion of any restaurant premises.

1:32 PM Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel. ADA appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Charges read by Court.  Attorney rights given.  Bond set at $. Bond form.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
